tip: Always test your soil before planting to understand its nutrient content and pH level.
Water plants early in the morning to reduce evaporation and fungal growth.
Use mulch around plants to retain soil moisture and suppress weeds.
Rotate crops each season to prevent soil depletion and reduce pests.
Choose native plants that are well adapted to your local climate and soil.
Prune plants regularly to encourage healthy growth and remove dead or diseased branches.
Use compost to enrich soil with organic matter and improve plant health.
Control weeds early before they compete with your plants for nutrients and water.
Provide proper spacing between plants to ensure g  ood air circulation and reduce disease risk.
Keep gardening tools clean and sharp to prevent spreading diseases and make work easier.
